utterly destroyed you
"Farewell, Mathilda. I go with
the belief that I have your pardon.
Your gentle nature would not per-
mit you to hate your greatest enemy
and though I be he, although I have
rent happiness from your grasp; though
I have passed over your young love
and hopes as the angel of destruction, find
ing beauty and joy, and leaving blight
and despair, yet you will forgive me,
and with eyes overflowing with tears I
thank you; my beloved one, I accept your
pardon with a gratitude that will
never die, and that will, outlive, in
-deed it will, outlive guilt and remorse.
"Farewell for ever!"
The moment I finished this letter
I ordered the carriage and prepared to
follow my father. The words of his letter
